body:
# matrix [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/Exilor/matrix.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/Exilor/matrix)


This is a Matrix class for [Crystal](https://github.com/crystal-lang/crystal).
There are a few ways to create a Matrix:
```crystal
# Creates a Matrix of Int32 with 3 rows and 2 columns. A Tuple of rows can also 
# be used instead of an array. Each row must have the same number of elements.
Matrix.rows([[1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6]]) 
# 1, 2
# 3, 4
# 5, 6

# Creates a Matrix with 2 rows and 3 columns. Like with Matrix.rows, the columns 
# must have the same number of elements.
Matrix.columns([[1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6]])
# 1, 3, 5
# 2, 4, 6

# A Matrix can also be created by giving its number of columns and rows, just 
# like an Array can be created by giving it a starting size. This constructor 
# will yield the linear index, the current row and the current column.
Matrix.new(2, 2) { |idx, row, col| idx  }
# 0, 1
# 2, 3
Matrix.new(2, 2) { |idx, row, col| row  }
# 0, 0
# 1, 1
Matrix.new(2, 2) { |idx, row, col| col  }
 # 0, 1
 # 0, 1
```

Most methods are documented in the matrix.cr file itself.

class_methods.name: column
class_methods.doc: Creates a single column matrix with the given values.
class_methods.summary: Creates a single column matrix with the given values.

class_methods.name: columns
class_methods.doc: Creates a matrix interpreting each argument as a column.
class_methods.summary: Creates a matrix interpreting each argument as a column.

def.name: columns
def.body:
if columns.any? do |column|
  column.size != columns[0].size
end
  raise(NotRegular.new)
end
Matrix.new(columns.first.size, columns.size) do |i, r, c|
  columns[c][r]
end

class_methods.name: diagonal
class_methods.doc:
Creates a diagonal matrix with the supplied arguments. Best suited to
numeric matrices.
class_methods.summary: Creates a diagonal matrix with the supplied arguments.

def.name: diagonal
def.body:
matrix = Matrix(T).new(values.size, values.size)
values.each_with_index do |e, i|
  matrix[i, i] = e
end
matrix

class_methods.name: identity
class_methods.doc: Creates a Matrix(Int32), whose diagonal values are 1 and the rest are 0.
class_methods.summary: Creates a Matrix(Int32), whose diagonal values are 1 and the rest are 0.

def.name: identity
def.body:
Matrix.new(row_or_col_size, row_or_col_size) do |i, r, c|
  r == c ? 1 : 0
end

class_methods.name: row
class_methods.doc: Creates a single row matrix with the given values.
class_methods.summary: Creates a single row matrix with the given values.

class_methods.name: rows
class_methods.doc: Creates a matrix interpreting each argument as a row.
class_methods.summary: Creates a matrix interpreting each argument as a row.

def.name: rows
def.body:
if rows.any? do |row|
  row.size != rows[0].size
end
  raise(NotRegular.new)
end
Matrix.new(rows.size, rows.first.size) do |i, r, c|
  rows[r][c]
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a matrix with the given number of rows and columns. It yields the
linear, row and column indexes in that order.
constructors.summary: Creates a matrix with the given number of rows and columns.
constructors.args_string: (rows : Int, columns : Int, &block : Int32, Int32, Int32 -> T)

def.name: new
def.body:
(Matrix(T).new(rows, columns)).tap do |m|
  r, c = 0, 0
  m.size.times do |i|
    m[i] = yield i, r, c
    c = c + 1
    if r == rows
      c = c + 1
      r = 0
    end
    if c == columns
      r = r + 1
      c = 0
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.doc: Performs multiplication with another matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Performs multiplication with another matrix.

def.body:
if @columns == other.row_count
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
new_rows, new_cols = @rows, other.column_count
(Matrix(typeof(self[0] * other[0])).new(new_rows, new_cols)).tap do |m|
  pos = -1
  @rows.times do |i|
    new_cols.times do |j|
      n = (0...@columns).reduce(0) do |memo, k|
        memo + ((at(i, k)) * other[k, j])
      end
      m[pos = pos + 1] = (typeof(self[0] * other[0])).new(n)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.doc: Performs exponentiation
instance_methods.summary: Performs exponentiation

def.body:
m = self
if other == 0
  Matrix.identity(@columns)
else
  if other < 0
    (repeated_square_power(other.abs)).inverse
  else
    if other == 1
      clone
    else
      repeated_square_power(other)
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.doc: Performs addition with another matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Performs addition with another matrix.

def.body:
if dimensions == other.dimensions
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
Matrix.new(@rows, @columns) do |i|
  (at(i)) + other[i]
end

instance_methods.doc: Performs subtraction with another matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Performs subtraction with another matrix.

def.body:
if dimensions == other.dimensions
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
Matrix.new(@rows, @columns) do |i|
  (at(i)) - other[i]
end

instance_methods.doc:
Returns a new matrix of the same size after calling the unary #- method
on every element. Best suited to numeric matrices.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a new matrix of the same size after calling the unary #- method on every element.

instance_methods.doc: Performs division with another matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Performs division with another matrix.

instance_methods.doc: Checks equality between self and another matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Checks equality between self and another matrix.

def.body:
if dimensions == other.dimensions
else
  return false
end
size.times do |i|
  if (at(i)) == other[i]
  else
    return false
  end
end
true

instance_methods.doc: Retrieves the element at the given linear index. Raises IndexError.
instance_methods.summary: Retrieves the element at the given linear index.

instance_methods.doc:
Retrieves the element at the given row and column indexes.
Raises IndexError.
instance_methods.summary: Retrieves the element at the given row and column indexes.

instance_methods.doc: Replaces the element at the given row and column with the given value.
instance_methods.summary: Replaces the element at the given row and column with the given value.

def.body:
if row >= @rows || column >= @columns
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if row < 0
  row = row + @rows
end
if column < 0
  column = column + @columns
end
if 0 <= row && 0 <= column
else
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
@buffer[column + (row * @columns)] = value

instance_methods.doc: Replaces the element at the given linear index with the given value.
instance_methods.summary: Replaces the element at the given linear index with the given value.

def.body:
if index >= size
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if index < 0
  index = index + size
end
if index < 0
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
@buffer[index] = value

instance_methods.doc:
Retrieves the element at the given row and column indexes.
Returns nil if out of bounds.
instance_methods.summary: Retrieves the element at the given row and column indexes.

instance_methods.doc:
Retrieves the element at the given linear index. Returns nil if out of
bounds
instance_methods.summary: Retrieves the element at the given linear index.

instance_methods.name: at
instance_methods.doc:
Retrieves the element at the given row and column indexes.
Yields if out of bounds.
instance_methods.summary: Retrieves the element at the given row and column indexes.

def.name: at
def.body:
if column < 0
  column = column + @columns
end
if row < 0
  row = row + @rows
end
if ((row >= @rows || column >= @columns) || row < 0) || column < 0
  yield
else
  @buffer[column + (row * @columns)]
end

instance_methods.name: at
instance_methods.doc:
Retrieves the element at the given row and column indexes.
Raises IndexError.
instance_methods.summary: Retrieves the element at the given row and column indexes.

instance_methods.name: at
instance_methods.doc:
Retrieves the element at the given linear index.
Yields if out of bounds.
instance_methods.summary: Retrieves the element at the given linear index.

def.name: at
def.body:
if index < 0
  index = index + size
end
if index >= size || index < 0
  yield
else
  @buffer[index]
end

instance_methods.name: at
instance_methods.doc:
Retrieves the element at the given linear index.
Raises if out of bounds.
instance_methods.summary: Retrieves the element at the given linear index.

instance_methods.name: clone
instance_methods.doc: Creates an identical matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Creates an identical matrix.

instance_methods.name: column
instance_methods.doc: Yields elements of the column at the given index.
instance_methods.summary: Yields elements of the column at the given index.

def.name: column
def.body:
if index >= @columns
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if index < 0
  index = index + @columns
end
if index < 0
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
@rows.times do |i|
  yield at(i, index)
end
self

instance_methods.name: column
instance_methods.doc: Returns an iterator for the elements of the column at the given index.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an iterator for the elements of the column at the given index.

def.name: column
def.body:
if column_index >= @columns
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if column_index < 0
  column_index = column_index + @columns
end
if column_index < 0
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
ColumnIterator.new(self, 0, column_index)

instance_methods.doc: The number of columns.
instance_methods.summary: The number of columns.

instance_methods.name: column_vectors
instance_methods.doc: Returns an array of smaller matrices, each representing a column from self.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an array of smaller matrices, each representing a column from self.

instance_methods.name: columns
instance_methods.doc: Returns an array of arrays that correspond to the columns of the matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an array of arrays that correspond to the columns of the matrix.

instance_methods.name: determinant
instance_methods.doc: Returns the determinant of the matrix. Only useful for numeric matrices.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the determinant of the matrix.

instance_methods.name: diagonal?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if all non-diagonal elements are 0.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if all non-diagonal elements are 0.

def.name: diagonal?
def.body:
if square?
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
each(:off_diagonal) do |e|
  if e == 0
  else
    return false
  end
end
true

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc:
Yields every element of the matrix linearly: First the elements of the first
row, then the elements of the second row, etc.
instance_methods.summary: Yields every element of the matrix linearly: First the elements of the first row, then the elements of the second row, etc.

def.name: each
def.body:
size.times do |i|
  yield at(i)
end
self

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc:
Like #each but with a Symbol directive that causes the method to skip
certain indices:
  :all            -> equivalent to a simple #each (yields every element)
  :diagonal       -> yields elements in the diagonal
  :off_diagonal   -> yields elements not in the diagonal
  :lower          -> yields elements at or below the diagonal
  :strict_lower   -> yields elements below the diagonal
  :upper          -> yields elements at or above the diagonal
  :strict_upper   -> yields elements above the diagonal
instance_methods.summary: Like #each but with a Symbol directive that causes the method to skip certain indices: :all -> equivalent to a simple #each (yields every element) :diagonal -> yields elements in the diagonal :off_diagonal -> yields elements not in the diagonal :lower -> yields elements at or below the diagonal :strict_lower -> yields elements below the diagonal :upper -> yields elements at or above the diagonal :strict_upper -> yields elements above the diagonal

instance_methods.name: each_index
instance_methods.doc:
Yields every row and column index.
See #each for the optional directives.
instance_methods.summary: Yields every row and column index.

def.name: each_index
def.body:
each_with_index(which) do |e, r, c|
  yield r, c
end

instance_methods.name: each_with_index
instance_methods.doc:
Yields every element along with its row and column index.
See #each for the optional directives.
instance_methods.summary: Yields every element along with its row and column index.

def.name: each_with_index
def.body:
r, c = 0, 0
each do |e|
  case which
  when :all
    yield e, r, c
  when :diagonal
    if r == c
      yield e, r, c
    end
  when :off_diagonal
    if r != c
      yield e, r, c
    end
  when :lower
    if r >= c
      yield e, r, c
    end
  when :strict_lower
    if r > c
      yield e, r, c
    end
  when :upper
    if r <= c
      yield e, r, c
    end
  when :strict_upper
    if r < c
      yield e, r, c
    end
  else
    raise(ArgumentError.new)
  end
  c = c + 1
  if r == @rows
    c = c + 1
    r = 0
  end
  if c == @columns
    r = r + 1
    c = 0
  end
end

instance_methods.name: empty?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if the matrix has either 0 rows or 0 columns.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the matrix has either 0 rows or 0 columns.

def.name: hash
def.body:
reduce((31 * @rows) * @columns) do |memo, e|
  (31 * memo) + e.hash
end

instance_methods.name: index
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the row and column index of the first occurrence of "value" in
the matrix, nil otherwise.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the row and column index of the first occurrence of "value" in the matrix, nil otherwise.

def.name: index
def.body:
each_with_index(which) do |e, r, c|
  if e == value
    return {r, c}
  end
end
nil

instance_methods.name: index
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the row and column index of the first occurrence of the block
returning true, nil otherwise
instance_methods.summary: Returns the row and column index of the first occurrence of the block returning true, nil otherwise

def.name: index
def.body:
i = 0
each_with_index do |e, r, c|
  if yield e, i, r, c
    return {r, c}
  end
  i = i + 1
end
nil

def.name: inspect
def.body:
io << "Matrix["
@rows.times do |t|
  io << '['
  i = 0
  row(t) do |e|
    e.inspect(io)
    if i == (@columns - 1)
    else
      io << ", "
    end
    i = i + 1
  end
  io << ']'
  if t == (@rows - 1)
  else
    (io << ',') << ' '
  end
end
io << ']'

instance_methods.name: inverse
instance_methods.doc: Returns the inverse of the matrix. Only useful for numeric matrices.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the inverse of the matrix.

def.name: inverse
def.body:
if square?
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
last = @rows - 1
a = Matrix.new(@rows, @columns) do |i|
  (at(i)).to_f
end
m = Matrix.new(@rows, @columns) do |i, r, c|
  r == c ? 1.0 : 0.0
end
0.upto(last) do |k|
  i = k
  akk = a[k, k].abs
  (k + 1).upto(last) do |j|
    v = a[j, k].abs
    if v > akk
      i = j
      akk = v
    end
  end
  if akk == 0
    raise(NotRegular.new)
  end
  if i != k
    a.swap_rows(i, k)
    m.swap_rows(i, k)
  end
  akk = a[k, k]
  0.upto(last) do |ii|
    if ii == k
      next
    end
    q = a[ii, k] / akk
    a[ii, k] = 0.0
    (k + 1).upto(last) do |j|
      __temp_20 = ii
      __temp_21 = j
      a[__temp_20, __temp_21] = a[__temp_20, __temp_21] - (a[k, j] * q)
    end
    0.upto(last) do |j|
      __temp_23 = ii
      __temp_24 = j
      m[__temp_23, __temp_24] = m[__temp_23, __temp_24] - (m[k, j] * q)
    end
  end
  (k + 1).upto(last) do |j|
    a[k, j] = a[k, j] / akk
  end
  0.upto(last) do |j|
    m[k, j] = m[k, j] / akk
  end
end
m

instance_methods.name: lower_triangular?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if the matrix is a lower triangular matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the matrix is a lower triangular matrix.

def.name: lower_triangular?
def.body:
if square?
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
each(:strict_upper) do |e|
  if e == 0
  else
    return false
  end
end
true

instance_methods.name: map
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a new matrix with the return values of the block.
Yields the element and its linear, row and column indices in that order.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a new matrix with the return values of the block.

def.name: map
def.body:
Matrix.new(@rows, @columns) do |i, r, c|
  yield at(i), i, r, c
end

instance_methods.name: map!
instance_methods.doc:
Changes the values of the matrix according to the return values of the
block.
Yields the element and its linear, row and column indices in that order.
instance_methods.summary: Changes the values of the matrix according to the return values of the block.

def.name: map!
def.body:
i = 0
each_with_index do |e, r, c|
  self[i] = yield e, i, r, c
  i = i + 1
end

instance_methods.name: minor
instance_methods.doc: Returns a subsection of the matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a subsection of the matrix.
instance_methods.args_string: (start_row : Int, rows : Int, start_col : Int, columns : Int)

def.name: minor
def.body:
if rows < 0 || columns < 0
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
if (start_row + rows) > @rows
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if (start_col + columns) > @columns
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if start_row < 0
  start_row = start_row + @rows
end
if start_col < 0
  start_col = start_col + @columns
end
if start_row < 0 || start_col < 0
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
(Matrix(T).new(rows, columns)).tap do |m|
  m.each_index do |r, c|
    min_r = ((start_row - r) + rows) - 1
    min_c = ((start_col - c) + columns) - 1
    i = -1 - ((c + (r * columns)) - (rows * columns))
    m[i] = at(min_r, min_c)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: minor
instance_methods.doc: Returns a subsection of the matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a subsection of the matrix.

def.name: minor
def.body:
start_row, rows = row_range.begin, row_range.end
start_col, columns = col_range.begin, col_range.end
if row_range.excludes_end?
else
  rows = rows + 1
end
if col_range.excludes_end?
else
  columns = columns + 1
end
minor(start_row, rows, start_col, columns)

instance_methods.name: permutation?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if the matrix is a permutation matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the matrix is a permutation matrix.

def.name: permutation?
def.body:
if square?
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
@rows.times do |i|
  found = 0
  row(i) do |e|
    case e
    when 0
      next
    when 1
      found = found + 1
    else
      return false
    end
  end
  if found == 1
  else
    return false
  end
  found = 0
  column(i) do |e|
    case e
    when 0
      next
    when 1
      found = found + 1
    else
      return false
    end
  end
  if found == 1
  else
    return false
  end
end
true

instance_methods.name: rank
instance_methods.doc: Returns the rank of the matrix. Only useful for numeric matrices.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the rank of the matrix.

def.name: rank
def.body:
m = clone
pivot_row = 0
prev_piv = 1
0.upto(@columns - 1) do |k|
  switch_row = (pivot_row...@rows).find do |row|
    m[row, k] != 0
  end
  if switch_row
    if pivot_row == switch_row
    else
      m.swap_rows(switch_row, pivot_row)
    end
    pivot = m[pivot_row, k]
    (pivot_row + 1).upto(@rows - 1) do |i|
      (k + 1).upto(@columns - 1) do |j|
        m[i, j] = ((pivot * m[i, j]) - (m[i, k] * m[pivot_row, j])) / prev_piv
      end
    end
    pivot_row = pivot_row + 1
    prev_piv = pivot
  end
end
pivot_row

instance_methods.name: regular?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if the matrix is regular.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the matrix is regular.

instance_methods.name: reverse!
instance_methods.doc: Reverses the order of the matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Reverses the order of the matrix.

def.name: reverse!
def.body:
i = 0
j = size - 1
while i < j
  @buffer.swap(i, j)
  i = i + 1
  j = j - 1
end
self

instance_methods.name: row
instance_methods.doc: Returns an iterator for the elements of the row at the given index.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an iterator for the elements of the row at the given index.

def.name: row
def.body:
if row_index >= @rows
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if row_index < 0
  row_index = row_index + @rows
end
if row_index < 0
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
RowIterator.new(self, row_index)

instance_methods.name: row
instance_methods.doc: Yields elements of the row at the given index.
instance_methods.summary: Yields elements of the row at the given index.

def.name: row
def.body:
if index >= @rows
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if index < 0
  index = index + @rows
end
if index < 0
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
@columns.times do |i|
  yield at(index, i)
end
self

instance_methods.name: row_count
instance_methods.doc: The number of rows.
instance_methods.summary: The number of rows.

instance_methods.name: row_vectors
instance_methods.doc: Returns an array of smaller matrices, each representing a row from self.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an array of smaller matrices, each representing a row from self.

instance_methods.name: rows
instance_methods.doc: Returns an array of arrays that correspond to the rows of the matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an array of arrays that correspond to the rows of the matrix.

instance_methods.name: shuffle!
instance_methods.doc: Shuffles the elements of the matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Shuffles the elements of the matrix.

instance_methods.name: shuffle_columns!
instance_methods.doc: Shuffles the elements of each column.
instance_methods.summary: Shuffles the elements of each column.

instance_methods.name: shuffle_rows!
instance_methods.doc: Shuffles the elements of each row.
instance_methods.summary: Shuffles the elements of each row.

instance_methods.name: singular?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if the matrix is singular.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the matrix is singular.

instance_methods.name: size
instance_methods.doc: The total number of elements.
instance_methods.summary: The total number of elements.

instance_methods.name: square?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if the number of rows equals the number of columns.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the number of rows equals the number of columns.

instance_methods.name: swap_columns
instance_methods.doc: Swaps two columns.
instance_methods.summary: Swaps two columns.

def.name: swap_columns
def.body:
if col_1 >= @columns || col_2 >= @columns
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if col_1 < 0
  col_1 = col_1 + @columns
end
if col_2 < 0
  col_2 = col_2 + @columns
end
if col_1 < 0 || col_2 < 0
  aise(IndexError.new)
end
@rows.times do |i|
  self[i, col_1], self[i, col_2] = at(i, col_2), at(i, col_1)
end
self

instance_methods.name: swap_rows
instance_methods.doc: Swaps two rows.
instance_methods.summary: Swaps two rows.

def.name: swap_rows
def.body:
if row_1 >= @rows || row_2 >= @rows
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
if row_1 < 0
  row_1 = row_1 + @rows
end
if row_2 < 0
  row_2 = row_2 + @rows
end
if row_1 < 0 || row_2 < 0
  raise(IndexError.new)
end
@columns.times do |i|
  self[row_1, i], self[row_2, i] = at(row_2, i), at(row_1, i)
end
self

instance_methods.name: symmetric?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if the matrix is symmetric.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the matrix is symmetric.

def.name: symmetric?
def.body:
if square?
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
each_with_index(:strict_upper) do |e, r, c|
  if e == (at(c, r))
  else
    return false
  end
end
true

instance_methods.name: to_a
instance_methods.doc: Returns an array of every element in the matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an array of every element in the matrix.

instance_methods.name: to_h
instance_methods.doc: Returns a hash: {row_index, column_index} => element
instance_methods.summary: Returns a hash: {row_index, column_index} => element

def.name: to_h
def.body:
hash = {} of ::Tuple(Int32, Int32) => T
each_with_index do |e, r, c|
  hash[{r, c}] = e
end
hash

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc: Displays the matrix in a more readable form.
instance_methods.summary: Displays the matrix in a more readable form.

def.name: to_s
def.body:
if @rows == 1
  io << '['
  each_with_index do |e, r, c|
    e.inspect(io)
    if c == (@columns - 1)
    else
      io << ' '
    end
  end
  io << ']'
else
  max_size = max_of do |__arg0|
    __arg0.inspect.size
  end
  io << ''
  corner = true
  @rows.times do |t|
    if corner || (t == (@rows - 1))
    else
      io << ''
    end
    if t == (@rows - 1)
      io << ''
    end
    i = 0
    row(t) do |e|
      size = e.inspect.size
      (max_size - size).times do
        io << ' '
      end
      e.inspect(io)
      if i == (@columns - 1)
      else
        io << ' '
      end
      if ((i == (@columns - 1)) && (!corner)) && (t != (@rows - 1))
        io << ''
      end
      i = i + 1
    end
    if t == 0
      io << ''
    end
    if t == (@rows - 1)
      io << ''
    end
    if t == (@rows - 1)
    else
      io << '\n'
    end
    corner = false
  end
end

instance_methods.name: trace
instance_methods.doc: Returns the sum of the diagonal elements. Only useful for numeric matrices.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the sum of the diagonal elements.

def.name: trace
def.body:
if square?
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
(0...@columns).reduce(0) do |memo, i|
  memo + (at(i, i))
end

instance_methods.name: transpose
instance_methods.doc: Changes the rows into columns and vice versa.
instance_methods.summary: Changes the rows into columns and vice versa.

def.name: transpose
def.body:
(Matrix(T).new(@columns, @rows)).tap do |m|
  first = 0
  while first <= ((@columns * @rows) - 1)
    succ = first
    i = 0
    while !succ <= first
      i = i + 1
      succ = ((succ % @rows) * @columns) + (succ / @rows)
    end
    if (i == 1) || succ < first
    else
      temp = at(succ = first)
      loop do
        i = ((succ % @rows) * @columns) + (succ / @rows)
        m[succ] = i == first ? temp : at(i)
        succ = i
        if succ <= first
          break
        end
      end
    end
    first = first + 1
  end
end

instance_methods.name: upper_triangular?
instance_methods.doc: Returns true if the matrix is an upper triangular matrix.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if the matrix is an upper triangular matrix.

def.name: upper_triangular?
def.body:
if square?
else
  raise(DimensionMismatch.new)
end
each(:strict_lower) do |e|
  if e == 0
  else
    return false
  end
end
true

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (matrix : Matrix(T), row = 0, col = 0, directive = :all)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = ItemIterator(T).allocate
_.initialize(matrix, row, col, directive)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: next
def.body:
skip = case @directive
when :all
  false
when :diagonal
  @row != @col
when :off_diagonal
  @row == @col
when :lower
  @row < @col
when :strict_lower
  @row <= @col
when :upper
  @row > @col
when :strict_upper
  @row >= @col
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new)
end
no_more_rows? = (@row + 1) >= @matrix.row_count
no_more_cols? = (@col + 1) >= @matrix.column_count
if no_more_rows? && no_more_cols?
  value = @matrix.at(@row, @col) do
    return stop
  end
  @col = @col + 1
else
  if (!no_more_rows?) && no_more_cols?
    value = @matrix[@row, @col]
    @col = 0
    @row = @row + 1
  else
    value = @matrix[@row, @col]
    @col = @col + 1
  end
end
skip ? self.next : value
